Description: Handle-plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of confronting sirens (mostly worn); around edge of handle plate, black band; on underside of plate and handle worn glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 222)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 113, no. A187, pl. VII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.048) (Phase 1)
